fws_master
Class MeasurementCollector

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      fws_master.MeasurementCollector
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class MeasurementCollector
extends java.lang.Thread

A thread that pulls the data of the stations. This data is collected and a text file is generated with the current values in it. This happens in a certain interval.

Author:
Johannes Kasberger

run

run in class java.lang.Thread

getData

private java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> getData()
Collects the Data from the Stations, add it to the MeasurementHistory and extract the current value of all active InputParameters. The station manages all Measurements in one collection. So the Measurements must be sorted before the average of the last values can be calculated. The sorting happens with a HashMap. The different measurements are added to the collection. After all Measurements are sorted the output can be generated.

Returns:
Result for the text file

checkDayChanged

private void checkDayChanged()
Check if new Day started

buildOutput

private java.lang.String buildOutput(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.Vector<Measurement>> data)
Builds the Output for the current status message. Adds the measurements to the History.

Parameters:
data - Measurements of a slave, all of the same sensor (e.g. temperature of station 1)
Returns:
Parameter Name:Average Value;Standard deviation of value;

Gets the Measurement from the History

Returns:
History of values

buildPlots

private void buildPlots()
Generates the plots. Each InputBinding can require one or more plots. These are saved in a collection of PlotConfig values. For each PlotConfig one Diagram is generated.
